r5GWncgLKvhaKCD7sODk6Q.text: Excellent food! If you want to eat healthy, this may be the best spot in Charlotte.  Incredible value!  Try their spicy avocado and lime bowl--it rocks!

OBias1vGnSBQiH_y16WD-Q.text: Delicious healthy food at a great price.  Looking forward to stopping by again!  I got the spicy avocado lime bowl with greens and added chicken after missing lunch today and it was the perfect amount of food that I needed!

LrZ6JUfamLdyuF_x0hNzsA.text: Interesting and excellent burgers! Strawberry lemonade drink was really good too. I used their app to order and pickup.

172tUdgejaVPbgnygR-uhw.text: Food was good. Place is well organized. Wait is not long at all even though it looks like it might be. The only issue we had was that it was very loud and hard to hear. People taking orders have hard time hearing the customers and you might get a wrong order. Staff is very nice and polite. Overall, good experience.

XvFlKP5M4QS5UcTFPBjIcw.text: I ordered a to-go Southwest Chicken salad from here. I ended up pulling out basically an entire stem with flowers coming off of it that was meant to be my greens I guess (flowers?? what??? I get that they're greens, but at least trim off the flowers), avocado skin, and the black bean and corn salsa were crunchy. I'm willing to give this place another try, but I doubt I will try this entree again. The people who I picked up my order from were very kind, and the place seemed clean, at least.

L-OY-v--gSu-i1pCYpVjrA.text: Besides the fact that the service is very slow, my beef patty burger was completley raw and cold in the middle. Will not be returning here and would not recommend to a friend.

KOD9sLyqTzGOxW5YDTf_2A.text: This place is insanely fresh. The quinoa bowls and salads are great. The service is super fast and even the smoothies taste great. Highly recommended for a delicious, casual, healthy meal.

mtZrF59Qq5pRwMiFd4Zj0w.text: I have been to this location many times and this was the first time my meal was not correct after ordering online. I get home and my citrus and Avocado salad had no chicken. After paying extra and having it as an addition I expected it to be there. I am very disappointed.

Hs3xxUj-zpjoGI9ptX9vSQ.text: No prices on the menu. When I got up to the register- I assumed that the sandwich came with a side. It does not. I also assumed there was no charge for veggies instead of the bun. There is a charge. All things that the lady at the register could have told me before hand. Anyways my order: Turkey Burger - West Side style ($7.49) with veggies instead of bun. (substitution cost $2.99) and Harvest Kale Salad as my side ($5.99). After tax, my lunch cost me $17.66 and I didn't even get a drink! This place is outrageously expensive! The food was good, but its not almost $18 good.

SXQ79pc60rmuCUPPcpHi0g.text: I have eaten here twice, both times, a bowl or salad thing and both times I loved how healthy it was and how good it tasted.  However, I do have two complaints that really bugged me both times.  1) It is so loud in there.  There are a million hard surfaces and nothing to absorb the sound.  I had a hard time hearing my lunchmate talk.  This could be easily solved with some design choices that soften the clatter.  2) I wonder if their hoods are sufficient.  Both times, my suit smelled like good after I left which made me feel like the exhaust is inadequate.  Not the biggest problem in the world except almost everyone eating there is in work clothes and would prefer not to dry clean because they are there.  The good is so good, I will overlook my complaints but would be so happy if those changes got made.

vuYtZRzSVKCBVDnVE2xzuA.text: For my first visit and thus far each time I have visited, I found the staff very knowledgeable and friendly.  It has encouraged me to want to come back and also tell others of my visit.  Love the food as well, must try something new on each visit.  But right now I am stuck on the smoothies, eggplant meatballs and sweet potato fries!!

BWfnBag8MDfYHQTVAxHoSg.text: Great burgers and healthy options. I would recommend ordering on the app or online to slip the line because it gets pretty long. I loved the SalBacado burger.

r1qlLHhAOlzRWAnZO103jw.text: Variety of healthy and fresh options for a quick, nutritious and delicious lunch - a highly recommended add to the lunch rotations of anyone working uptown!

c9EPRdkrEIzZ8Y0ZOpTYPA.text: Stopped by on a Saturday afternoon waiting for a concert to start in the park across the street--really happy we did! Love the concept, the crew was super friendly, and the food was fantastic. My partner had the turkey burger and said it was so good it didn't even need condiments, and my spicy avocado lime bowl was beyond delicious (and huge!). Had a cherry-peach smoothie for dessert and it was awesome-just the flavor of real fruit and not too sweet. We'll be back next time we come through Charlotte!

hRgl3t6BxS43rD-Ioc_fQA.text: My new favorite lunch spot!! Soooo fresh, healthy, & delicious! The staff is super nice & food made quick! The rush lunch hour gets pretty crazy, but you can order ahead on the app! The southwest chicken salad is amazing!! Cannot go wrong here!

9rzGMIvUjHao90MsY3Ld7A.text: This is my new favorite place. Every time I have been it has been SO good. I'm so happy to have this as a new lunch option uptown. Hope you guys set up shop in South Park eventually as well!

tSMXgjcx2p_7aHTNcAA5yg.text: Check out my burger delivered today. I didn't even have to tell them I was a vampire! So raw, yet so burnt on the edges. I screams of safety.

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States

95Xqm1VL3HaZs0cXcIORxg.text: Very slow and indifferent service; didn't get what I ordered on numerous occasions. Won't be back

bfXO7egHECWCTe2lKavYfw.text: In all fairness, we tried a second time before writing this review.  Both times we ordered online...  Bun burned  Fries cold Cheese not even melted  Called them on both occasions and all they said was sorry.  No attempt to make it right.  Sad service guys and poor quality food.

hprJKSR8-l2Z8OxZkW-XXQ.text: Healthy and good. Very accurate name. The food I've had( approx 5 visits) has all been good, I think it's a little bit overpriced for what you're paying for. Would return again

B6TYbYHJdsZ3Z65MUhIcXA.text: We tried this recently for lunch. It was obscenely crowded and they actually lost my order so it was over 30 minutes to get my food while all my friends finished their meals. The food was good though. It's like healthier versions of burgers and fries.   I think part of the chaos is caused by online orders mixing in with other orders. Hopefully they will improve on that. Though if I went back I would order online.

IYGz4JXRNWxlwWTTRFf8IA.text: My coworker and I went here for lunch and it was pretty good, but quite pricy. I was ok with the price though because I easily got 2 meals out of my spicy kale and avocado bowl- it was huge!! I got mine with grilled chicken, but honestly I don't even think it needed it. I also had the sweet potato fries which were delicious! My coworker had a burger which he said was good. The service was quick and easy and I will definitely be back to try more items.

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy kale and avocado bowl with grilled chicken- very good but I wish it were more spicy! Also, the sweet potato fries are delicious.
Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burger

2C5629rA6tZJKEhKtYsYzQ.text: I had such high hopes in this place. The customer service was the worst. They didn't make eye contact when I picked up my Togo order. I ordered the southwest salad and it was sloppily thrown together.  While I was in there the place was filled with smoke. They either didn't have vents or did not have them on. Their was over flowing garbage and garbage on the tables. The staff only seemed interested in talking amongst themselves. I'll never go back.

NuCrjk_T1P3pOOC6Yp3M7w.text: Not impressed with this new uptown location. Burger was raw and cold in the center. The kitchen staff just needs to slow down and cook the food.

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States. Not impressed with this new uptown location. Burger was raw and cold in the center.

HoiX_auoOhfNflpNBRwuNw.text: Solid spot for quick (relatively), healthy and local sourced food. Not gonna be fast food rates but you get a decent Amon too food for your $.

sygCsWCrgMIghUhH4jdazA.text: After too many months apart, finally was reunited today with the Spicy Avocado & Lime Kale & Quinoa Bowl, and the best Butternut Soup ever. The new Uptown Charlotte location has stunning interiors. The staff was professional, pleasant. And our cashier was fully versed on menu details -- he gave a glowing endorsement of the Adopted Luke burger -- and made it easy for us to complete an app BOGO redemption.

yE9GBVboteQp4YqsEBmcVA.text: Love B Good! Expensive but worth it. The salads are amazing! My favorite is the Kale. I also enjoy the Turkey Burger. The Zucchini and Veggie meatballs are tasty. Ask for a coupon, and on your next visit you can buy one burger or salad and get one free!

bHTdoPxZwUuujza0Ziltsg.text: This was the worst place I have been to in the history of places. I'm the ONLY vegan and all of my friends had regular burgers. All of them were a disaster. Their fries are microwaved! It's not the employees fault. It's a horrible business. We waited forever to get our orders out of order. They don't even deserve one star.

rmA2n-Homda6ldEvwweJhQ.text: Stumbled upon this looking for a place to eat before a sporting event. Food took 25 minutes from time we ordered. Burgers lacked any flavor and sweet potato fries were soggy. Way overpriced as well!!! $45 for three burgers!

ZE0q-arDh-xf8xzYzuI2tQ.text: B good? More like B Waiting..waited over 2 hours to get my "chicken burger" i ended up being vegan cause they gave me the wrong order..i still ate it cause i was hungry as heck tho. Also smoothies are not great. The Acai Berry was NOT so berry. On the bright side a foreign girl ended up flirting with me, but did not get the digits cause i got called up to get my food

DEqwVb1-akRkY31Ms2UJuw.text: I ordered online for 6 people. I love the options of fresh and healthy foods. Especially that they offer gluten free burgers (turkey and veggies for non-red meat eaters like myself)! The order included : 2 strawberry banana smoothies, roasted butternut salad with chicken, 2 zucchini spaghetti and eggplant meatballs, one Caesar salad without the chicken, Spivey avocado and lime with quinoa and chicken, spiced pumpkin smoothie and southwest salad. Everything was devoured! It was fresh and made on time- which I appreciated not having to wait. It was annoying with all the construction downtown - and no parking -to pick up so many "to-go orders" . I defied the law and just parked our front anyway... I will say I think the serving size is a bit small for the price. If you don't get certain ingredients like black beans or chicken added, I would say you're definitely not getting your money's worth AT ALL. Luckily I beat the lunch rush hour  so the lines weren't out the door. The place is trendy and cute like a farm to table feel. Staff was busy so didn't interact much- to rate their customer service. This is definitely a place I would try once on my own but order for company lunch especially if your staff eats healthy. Everyone absolutely loved their shakes including me. I do wish they labeled the salad dressings flavor- it's hard to determine who gets what salad dressing when there's for different salads and 4 different dressings. This is a solid 3.9 in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States

QU2m-_jaawHt4GChu6clBQ.text: The avocado chili lime bowl is absolutely amazing. Fresh incredible flavors and very healthy to boot.

AWIEaEp_e9Pp-ZLR4bFv-A.text: Food is good, service is friendly. Prices however are a little bit much for the type of restaurant this is.  Especially if you are getting a burger.  If you don't mind paying premium price for the food, then you will like this place.  WIll most likely not return.

4Tj3qEcbGRo6V5Ix7qansg.text: Love the food and concept but you smell horrible when you leave this place. The exhaust must not work properly.

eqMAwXpOfT8qW8JhYRFWaQ.text: Awesome place! It's nice to have a healthy and convenient option for lunch. Definitely get the app and order ahead!! I've had their turkey burgers and grain bowls, I recommend both! Also, get the elote!

etEJf6qdFwCFHQckYZHDeQ.text: This place is a real disappointment. For $16 I got a turkey burger, small salad and a drink. The turkey burger was disappointing with a stale/dry bun. The burger reminded me of the old Wendy's commercial - "where's the beef?". The salad was sad- barely filled half of a container and looked nothing like the picture. It was in huge chunks and the dressing was just globbed in one corner of it. I will say the drink was amazing. For $16 they can serve a larger turkey burger, prep the salad better and have fresh bread.

KQyCRiLAPq4rrU7a1CiH1A.text: Needed a quick bite while in the area, this happened to be right next to where I parked so I decided to give it a try.  They have a few healthier eating options available.  I went with the Mediterranean chicken bowl which included:  romaine, farro, grilled chicken, tomato, cucumber, green beans, feta, red pepper hummus, mint, sunflower seeds and za'atar vinaigrette.  It hit the spot at the time, nothing amazing but it was filling and lightweight.  Plenty of veggies and the vinaigrette added a nice flavor to top it all off.

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States

xdqRbFF25glfPSvz4lCm_w.text: Needed a quick healthy lunch on a busy day and decided to drop in... I WILL NOT be visiting again. The staff were rude and slow, and just stared at me as I waited for someone to take my order. When they finally did, it took forever to get a simple side salad. Upon returning to my office, I noticed that I had no dressing. So after another trek, and finally being able to sit down to eat, the food was just MEH.

M0EmbgGMyjQlATymioOlag.text: Still have ice in my smooth. Not a few cubes but a block of ice. Never had that happened in my life.

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States

3yLdWhoIWhseEUgNvMlxRQ.text: I work uptown, and was out at lunch walking around and wanted a quick bite before returning to the office.  this was my first time and menu looked interesting and saw the words 'fresh', 'natural'.  so instead of a salad, I wanted to try the burger and fries.  the line wasn't long at all when I arrived, so I figured, within 10 min. I should get my order.  it took 20 minutes for my order to be ready!  Hamburger was pretty good, no complaints.  but fries were the WORSE I've had.  soggy, cold, NOT cooked!  disappointing! I would give another try by ordering a salad next time.

ZLBAEJ650sEtVMqPVyHmsQ.text: Pro tip: Download the app and order from it to skip the (long) line. My friend and I did this for lunch on a Tuesday, and it saved us a ton of time. We ordered as we were walking there from the Duke Energy Center, and it was ready about 5 minutes after we arrived.  I got the Harvest Kale Salad ($8.49) with a bottle of water ($1.99). I should've just stuck with the water from their drink fountain, but I got a little confused with the app. Also, all their drinks seemed to be Maine Root, so no sodas here. The salad was bigger than I'd planned on, and I ate the whole thing. Nom nom nom. I love healthy food, but I'm still amazed at how tasty it was AND only 309 calories according to their website.  Although it was busy, there seemed to be enough seating - some individual tables and some community with a few tables outside. The price seemed normal enough for me for lunch, and I was glad to have somewhere a little healthier to try.

cCGWFfdQ3yZgnFtGxPlg-A.text: Me and my boyfriend decided to eat somewhere new today on his lunch break and we chose B.Good in Uptown Charlotte ... we hardly ever get lunch together because we work opposite schedules so we were excited to be able to do so today. We will not be coming back. It took over 20 min for him to get his burger, which literally looked like it was slipped on the plate... and on top of that there was a piece of chicken underneath it.....and it took over 40 minutes for my Mediterranean bowl to come out. He refused to eat his food without me so his food was cold by the time I got mine. We spent 90% of our time standing waiting for our food. We didn't have time to sit and eat so we had to get our food to go. NOT ONCE did we receive an apology. Terrible customer service & food presentation.

GC4mG0frreoXglp1zRwJwg.text: So healthy and good! Zucchini noodles with eggplant is perfect lunch! I added chicken to it   Ability to order online makes getting lunch there easy and quick

UTPOGh8Iz7e3LXVpOXoswQ.text: We could use more healthy lunch options in Charlotte.  So I really wanted to like B.Good.  Perhaps it was what I ordered, but I'm unlikely to be back.    I ordered the zucchini noodles with eggplant meatballs.  It was served in a paper bowl.  I could have eaten the paper bowl and been unable to taste the difference between the food and the paper.  Not much flavor, and the flavor that there was was simply not good.  They need to revamp their red sauce.  It sucks.    Twenty minutes after eating this way overpriced and sub-par lunch, I was firing kale out of my ass at warp speed.  Dear God!!! I nearly achieved lift off!  After 6, yes SIX, trips to the kamode, I finally ran out of anal ammo.  I may have to work this weekend given how much time I spent on the shitter during business hours yesterday.    I guess the upshot is that if you are trying to lose weight, this is the place to go.  Definitely a net loss of calories as the food ran through me in 20 minutes, and then continual muscles spasms and anal eruptions definitely resulted in net caloric burn.  I'd rather get on the treadmill for caloric burn. Speaking of burn, my brown eye is rubbed raw from yesterday's B.Good adventure.  I am not enjoying that.  Not at all.

qzC5rD7c0kvMlukW9GcCDA.text: If you like healthy food and a vegan snd into organic food. This is the place for you.Try the power bowl.. its delicious, simple, and of course healthy. The staff is friendly and service quick. Wish there were more around nationwide.

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States. Power Bowl...kale, grains and eggs.

5bucGwn3HqpABlkzABXRFw.text: Was very excited to try this new spot out. As soon as i walked through the front door here was an overt UNWELCOMING feeling from the unfriendly staff. They seemed to almost hate their job. I mean every single person was unhappy and rude. The one smoothie i ordered took 15 minutes to make. I watched the guy make his own smoothie first and then make mine (he worked there!). This was a terrible experience and not worth $5 or my time. I advise firing all the staff or maybe new management.

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States. Very disappointing. Staff unfriendly and rude. Service takes forever. Looks cool but not worth the time.

OTggm62wE1VwIdlCsBdPLQ.text: Customer service not great. Food mediocre. Order was in correct But i didn't bother to send it back. Fries tasted like they needed 10 more minutes  in the fryer.

6fflLrcNoECb5bUnY-Y5nA.text: More like B Okay.  I was excited to try B Good because to my knowledge, it's the only place in Uptown where you can order a burger with a gluten free bun. My interests may be niche, but nonetheless I was looking forward to giving this place a shot.  My first impression was that this place hasn't been finished yet. The restaurant is cavernous and stark with high ceilings and no sound absorption. It's deafening during the lunch rush but I'd imagine it's nearly as loud even when they're slow.   The layout is awkward. You place your order to the left, but there's hardly any room to queue up. This leaves patrons looking at one another in confusion, asking "is this the line? Are you in line?" The waiting area is in the center of the counter and it seems to be where everyone ordering to-go awkwardly gathers.   I went for lunch with a coworker and ordered first. I got the Cousin Oliver burger. When the woman behind the counter asked what cheese I'd like, I assumed that meant I had options included. Not so; when I got my receipt I saw I'd been charged $1.25 to add cheddar. Brutal.   After ordering to dine in, you're handed a buzzer and left to your own devices. We grabbed a table in the back and waited for our buzzers to light up. The plush chairs along the windows look comfy, but they're far too low for the tables and you'll feel like a child. If you're dining in, you'll have to leave your seat to go up and claim your meal. I'd imagine this is a real pain if you're lunching alone; abandon your table and you may return with nowhere to sit. I guess the cheese upcharges don't pay for a food runner.  My burger looked beautiful when I picked it up. You'll have to go to the right of the counter to get ketchup and mustard -- no other sauces or condiments seem to be available. As such, my burger felt very dry as I ate it.   The fries, by the way, don't seem to be worth the additional cost of including a side. Mine were pale and limp, without adequate seasoning (and only ketchup to dip 'em in, as noted above).   All told, a cheeseburger and fries set me back $14. I'd happily shell out this much for a great, flavorful burger, but that's not what I received. I wish I could offset this with high marks for service, but there really isn't any service, other than borderline predatory upcharging at the register.  Maybe it's my mistake for ordering a burger at a healthy lunch spot. I'm not against giving B Good another try with another dish, but I'm not in a rush to return.

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States

oJAOI_bZjqzQtnwmjDuHQw.text: This is def a fast favorite!  And they are consistent.  My biggest concern is that working so close may definitely have me broke by the end of the summer! I love that most of the food is locally sourced (look at me, doing my part to support local agriculture!)  Its also pretty darn tasty! For a long time I would only get the spicy avocado bowl because it was so freaking good, but this week I have ventured out and tried the zucchini spaghetti with eggplant 'meatless' balls....and they knocked my socks off....SO GOOD!  I did something a little outrageous to this veg friendly dish and added BACON!  Yup i did it and it was soooooo tasty!  But bacon makes most things that much better right... Even so, the dish stood pretty well on its own. The avocado toast is pretty good too. I love that B.Good has a fountain of all natural sodas, that my kids love.   If you are looking for a healthy fast food option this is definitely the way to go.   Next i think I will try the smoothies because they look pretty tasty too, with a variety of blends.  Great addition to my dine out roster!

nNxGPwm-aLkdiBIrxpBHEg.text: I'd like to start this off by saying the staff were very nice here. Also, the place looked very clean. Now, let's move on to the food: Whole wheat bun - dry Egg - dry Turkey burger - dry Avocado - bitter Sharp cheddar - NOT SHARP! Bacon - dry to the point where it was hard to bite - cooked the goodness right out of it :-(  Also, the soda fountain had some issue where the diet soda was not carbonated enough. The raspberry seltzer is also awful. I've let them know about the soda fountain, and that's usually a temporary issue anyway.  This place had three stars as of my review. I am sorry to say this was a harsh lesson in what happens when you dip below 3.5 star places and try to give a restaurant the benefit of the doubt. There are plenty of places within a couple of blocks that have 4+ stars and offer similar fare. I would suggest you try there first as I know I won't be trying this place again (which is a shame because I'm only a block away).

HzU-YW6cSUznZIjkX-yKDA.text: I gave this place 1 star solely based on the my customer experience here. This is by far one of the most unprofessional restaurants I've been to in a long time. I walked in and approached the counter with no acknowledgement. After I spoke to the cashier she then simply replied "yes." Staff was having personal conversations and were extremely loud. The food was great but based on the customer service and experience I will not be coming back here nor recommending this place to anyone else. There's way too many options here in Uptown to slack on customer service.

NykL0lDVIIldfKNaoJVJrw.text: It's easy to eat healthy here. Some intriguing things on the menu from Burgers to Grain Bowls. I went with the grilled chicken Southwest salad with avocado. It was the perfect size for lunch and quite tasty. I'd like to try the Burger but  just seems like of all the things on the menu you'd be better served with something else.

tctN9YVK5GxxD6Td4ZrcWA.text: 40 minutes for a burger and fries.  Talk about a break down in the process.  The person expediting the orders is also responsible for cooking the fries and making the smoothies at the other end.  Sorry B Good, but you're falling really short on the name and you R Bad.  Long story short, if you'll only have 30 mins to grab a quick healthy bite, this ain't the place to go.  45 mins and I left with a cold burger and soggy fries.

ozXvHeIPUB8lHooshloJaw.text: Eh!   I was excited to try this new place on my lunch since they offer quite a few vegetarian options. However, I was less than thrilled with my food that I ordered. I chose the Adopted Luke veggie burger, grilled corn and strawberry lemonade.   Cons:   Taste: While the quality of the food may be great, the taste is not "good" at all. Nothing on my veggie burger was seasoned. It was extremely bland  and unappealing.   Price: I paid $14 + for a veggie burger, side and drink -_-    Pros:   Customer service: I ended up requesting a new corn on the cob after  I saw that I received the smallest corn that they had on the grill. It was extremely small to the point that It shouldn't have been sold at its normal price of almost $5. The employees settled this issue quickly and even offered that I keep both cobs (I declined ).   Grilled corn: Though my original corn was tiny , it was replaced with an average sized piece that was pretty good. The jalapeno/ cilantro ranch was delish! It probably would be a great compliment to the bland burger that I got.

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie burger
Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled corn with Jalapeño ranch. Pretty tasty but tiny for almost $5

Cb75oV2QF8q6bTTHiGaB6w.text: This place is dirty and the staff is less than. From the bathrooms to the front to the ordering counter.  Lady cooking has 1 inch nails...OMG!

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States

_OE7_Na47vYMWFEW5Bj3rQ.text: I really want to like this place, the burgers are good, I like the natural ingredients concept, it's really close to where I work. I just need the staff to do the bare minimum and do things like take my order without making me feel like I'm inconveniencing them. The first time I went in, the service was lackluster but not terrible. The 2nd time, I stood at the counter for what felt like a very long time while I watched 2 staff members put slaw in cups and other prep work stuff. There was nobody in the restaurant- even though it was 5ish on a workday. Eventually I was at least acknowledged and was told they'd be with me "in just a minute". I continued to stand there for an awkwardly long time and decided to walk out- hangry and frustrated. I decided to give the ONE more chance and went in a couple of days ago after work. Again, I stood at the counter awkwardly. I asked someone in the back if I was in the right place to order and he said someone would be right with me. The server strolled to the counter and appeared to be unhappy. I wanted to ask her if I was inconveniencing her in some way, but continued my order. I couldn't understand her as she mumbled- i obviously annoyed her and it was really uncomfortable!!  I just wanted my burger and to get out of there quickly. I don't know what's going on- maybe I'm going in at the wrong time?  But why be open if it's not a good time. I get it, I used to work in the food service industry and it can be tough! All I ask is you make an effort to make me feel valued as a customer. I don't feel welcome at this location and don't plan to go back. Burgers are great but I'll find another place that appreciates my business.

_0GYhHuCNgRjslFtP9uZmw.text: B Good is just very average. I appreciate that they have a very "health conscious" menu, but every item I have tried has just been very meh. I have tried the Spicy Avocado and Lime bowl with chicken and it's decent but the kale is SO dry. The Zucchini Noodles and Eggplant Meatballs are pretty good, but I think if you order to go they need to plate the items separately because my zoodles were very soggy. I have also tried the other kale based salads and the kale was very dry in each. I do like their turkey burgers and you can order with a lettuce wrap instead of the bun. Also, bravo to the fact that their ketchup is Sir Kensington's!  Customer service here has never stood out to me and they get very behind during the lunch hour. I think for the price you can definitely find better options Uptown.

12jaTW3bJ95pCXhnG_MreQ.text: Had lunch with a buddy and he suggested this place which I had heard about but not tried.  In short, it was great!  Once you figure out that the menu lacks things like pancakes or whoppers, you really have a good variety of tasty meals to select from.  I had the power grain with grilled chicken added.  You also had the choice of adding quinoa or something called 7 grain.  I tasted each and preferred the 7 grain as it justed tasted better with the barley wheat pieces and it was a warm item, very tasty.  My friend had a salad with large fresh chunks of avocado that looked delish.  Overall the food was excellent (5/5).  It's a simple counter order and they give you a buzzer for when your food is ready. Simple and efficient (5/5).  Give it a whirl,  you'll enjoy it!!

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States. Power grain

XpUW4ueNv1u_wepTg76D6Q.text: I want to start by saying that I usually love b. good but this location has consistently giving me poor customer service. Today for example, my friend and i didn't get our order in for a good minute with no other customers in the restaurant. Then when we did get service the woman seemed so irritated with us, so we ordered, paid, tipped and waited and left as soon as we got our bag. We arrived home to find half our order missing, although we paid for all of it, and the restaurant not picking up after 20 minutes of calling. Safe to say we will not be returning

FBjL1SgEbm-g1-Er5ztZcQ.text: Got to check this place out today! Heard many good things. Went here on a Wednesday around 6pm and the place wasn't busy at all. 2 other people inside with food already, so many open tables.   Placing order was easy, no wait in line. We ordered one power burger wheat bun, side of "real fries", one kids chocolate milkshake. *TIP* if you download their app you can get a free side.    I liked that they have fancy lemonades and getting free side. Our wait time was ridiculous, it took so long for our small order. When they finally called our name, they told us our fries weren't ready yet but they didn't want us to wait since our burger was ready. We ate burger and almost whole shake before the fries came.   The appearance of the burger looked bomb! The bun and all the toppings were delicious, the taste of the burger itself - I wasn't impressed. The "real fries" which are their plain fries, were also pretty good! The chocolate shake was yummy! So overall just the wait & taste of their burger was disappointing considering price. I realize they are "root" based. Meaning they use fresh ingredients, locally from NC & SC which I love, so I kinda get the price. But the taste and wait, along with price explains my rating. I def still might give this place a second chance and hope they are better next time!   Good vibes from within. Workers were so so, not take friendly. They do have a healthy kids menu! $5.99. Kids shakes or "kale crush" smoothie both $2.99.

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States. My kinda lemonade
Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fresh ingredients
Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States. Current deals

xaUOcKlqd5srwf1vrK57AA.text: As mentioned by several other reviewers, my B Good experience was just 'B Okay'.   As a first-timer, I decided to go for their seasonal summer burger. It had a roasted corn salsa, bacon, & avocado on it. The flavor or of the burger was great, but the burger itself was small (i.e. a lot of extra bun around the edges) and overcooked. Had this been a nice juicy burger, this would have definitely warranted a 4-star review. I also think $8 for a burger only (had to pay $1.25 on top of that to add cheese) is steel for a fast casual place. That is honestly sit down price for me, so I'd be hesistant to come back based on that alone. After adding on $3.xx for some sweet potato fries, my meal came to about $14. Again, that's sit-down restaurant pricing.   My wife had gotten one of the quinoa salad/bowl meals, and hers was great. I would steer that route if you're keen on eating here. Sandwiches are definitely not work the hype or expense.   Side note: WHO DOESN'T CARRY RANCH DRESSING?! They had a jalapeno ranch ... can't you just leave the jalapeno out of some of the batch and carry both regular + jalapeno? What kind of savages run this place????

NDG-6236gN4k453zgAciQQ.text: The salad was horrible, I ordered the sweet potato and bacon (bacon was good) the sweet potatoes were so hard they broke my fork, needless to say I didn't finish the salad, definitely not worth it for $10, I tried someone's burger and it was pretty good, even though he said it was definitely overpriced for what he got, didn't even come with a side.

PquTjjQgvd9ieLWhfARr7A.text: Terrible service and so slow. Food is average. Not worth a return trip :( fries way too salty. Workers  bring in their friends hours before closing and make a lot of noise without buying anything-- they took up more seats than the actual customers!

2_PBbHj00LYoJBI-SnpCEw.text: Tried this place for the first time, and was kind of in a hurry so I did not get a chance to study the menu that well before choosing. I ordered a pretty basic burger with a gluten free bun, and I must say it tasted ...basic . All the burgers here are cooked 'well', you cannot choose. I do not doubt they use quality ingredients, but I wasn't blown away by the taste. I appreciate the time it took them to hand prepare my meal from scratch, the kitchen is open so you can witness them doing this. The restaurant itself is spacious, plainly decorated. I did enjoy the fresh juices/lemonades with herbal infusions. I'm sure there are greater things on the menu that I just need to go back a try.

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beet Ginger Lemonade
Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States

fZZuOEdRKGyV1ZnU1mxcOg.text: I came in and tried the Power Burger asked if it could be put into a wrap instead of a bun.. Apparently that couldn't be done.. ok cool.. I was given a buzzer and patiently waited for my food.. not sure if the grill was initially to hot or but my burger was burnt on the outside and if you ever tried a burnt burger you know that initial crunch and taste isn't the most pleasant and can definitely alter the burger.. other than that the place was pretty clean conveniently located next to the Park. Ketchup was interesting to say the least.

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States. B.good sign

Lg5Jt5dJHYjcN0070xONBg.text: Really good Burger, surprised after reading the reviews. Serving Jury duty and used UberEATS to order a burger on wheat with cheddar avacado, bacon and eggs. Tater great

G41B11tkmjHIXrwMwuT6Vw.text: I was really impressed with B Good.  I visited on 2 different occasions for takeout, but my order was pretty much the same, turkey burger and sweet potato fries.  I wanted a combination of the Cousin Oliver and the Adopted Luke, the turkey burger was hand packed with sauteed mushrooms, onions, lettuce, tomato, etc.  The burger is perfectly seasoned with all fresh toppings, a great bun, and made to order.....delish.  The sweet potato fries are baked and on my first visit were half burned so I would advise the staff to pay more attention to that with takeout orders.  Overall, the turkey burger was one of the best I've ever had, and I will be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey burger

2G9emgWSHEq-YmTGw32y5w.text: Typical health food place but great service. Manager took our order and explained the menu. Told us what sold well and gave us coupons for our next visit and Grubhub. I got a bowl with different veggies like Brussels sprouts, sweet potatoes, mushroom and cranberries topped with tofu. The smoothies are also good as well. They have eggplant "meat" balls that were good too but I found out after they weren't vegan because they have cheese in and on them.

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States

mQRVRJkVRxSoHH4nH-uphQ.text: Words can't express how absolutely disappointed I am in the take out service I received at B.GOOD  in Charlotte, NC! Not only was my food not ready in time, but it was sloppily thrown together. Even better? When I got home and opened my food, I find my burger bun completely burnt. On BOTH SIDES. Their employees consciously put this obviously burnt sandwich in my bag with no problem. I drove uptown on one of the busiest nights for this meal & deserve much better service than I received. Please do better. I couldn't  even go back to remedy this because the restaurant was already closed. I have excused the poor service in the past because your food is so good, but tonight was inexcusable.   What makes this worse? Over 17 hours and no response from B.Good. I've contacted them on various platforms. We all deserve better when we spend our hard earned money.

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States

5G5u9niWGRW4HgXhwyBRqQ.text: Fast and friendly service. Always a big fan of the Southwest Salad. Love how easy it is to order from the app.

BkkWHjvt4EC10qpgm1A1dA.text: We went for take out and our salads were ready very quickly. They tasted good and were healthy.

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States

e3GTs8T3fSldY9Cw_v9KYA.text: Our team ordered b.good in for lunch during a work meeting.  This is very convenient because they have an app (you can skip the line!!) and it's close to our work space.   I ordered the spicy avocado lime bowl with chicken and it was really good.    I think the new location is still working out their kinks, but it's nice to have a healthy restaurant to grab lunch on the go!

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy avocado bowl add chicken

vxBYWsu6JhFYicqHXncxTw.text: I had the spicy avocado & lime salad which could actually feed three of me! The portion was hefty, especially the quinoa & kale. It tasted lovely & lively - the lime really made the dish tasty. The chipotle  puree and the red pepper vinaigrette gave it the spicy zing! I would've enjoyed it more if they had added more avocado since there were only a few slices in proportion to the other ingredients. It was as fresh as they claimed it would be so I was satisfied. I also ordered the sweet potato fries on the side and unfortunately, it was soggy and way too salty for my buds. Their fresh juices, flavored lemonades and teas were delicious! I would've given them a 3.5 stars if only those sweet potato fries came out crispy and less salty. I'll try their other bowls next time I'm back in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States

P-P_DJKfAyPG_SRMc9Slkw.text: Decided to stop at this joint and get my baby some food for dinner. I think all the food they give for 5.99 is great. The kids meal comes with a decent entree selection, broccoli, apple sauce, drink, and regular  or sweet potato fries.  I got my kid the turkey burger and a kale smoothie. That's the trick to get your kid to eat veggies parents... smoothies. We got that first so i gave it to her first.   For $2 extra I was like what the fudge is this. They give you so little for a smoothie but then again it's not that bad.  However the turkey burger was extremely dry, like no juiciness at all. My daughter didn't eat it. I ate it because I was mad hungry. The fries were good and she didn't touch the broccoli but hey she already got kale and spinach from her smoothie so mission accomplished.  I may come back to see what's up with their other dishes... for adults.

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States. $2.00 Extra for this small kale smoothie for a kids meal???!!! Bologna!

Ts-zl8WFbMfXmw-Da4qU2w.text: Whoa this place is bad.  Dirty plates, cold bun, no napkins, tables were dirty.   Go somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States

TBb1j_UomvsBJ8WlZEY3Lw.text: Nothing special but decent food. Have ordered a few burgers from there -vegetarian, Turkey and beef. Veggie was good. They seem to be rushed and the toppings on burgers are always slid off making a big unnecessary mess while trying to eat it. I work right near there uptown so I really only go for convenience when the lines are not long.

v93NZIt0dVLnZfKPZOCaCQ.text: I like this place. The food is always yummy. The only thing they could work on is the smoothies. They taste like water. They have no flavor. Other than that I've enjoyed everything.

yyUqAnuRG7PA0DC5P71-cg.text: I had the southwest chicken salad. Overall the salad tasted pretty good. However, it is pretty small and not filling. To drink, I had the banana strawberry smooth which was very good.   The service was really slow so be prepared to wait. It's a decent option for lunch but I think you get more for your money at other salad spots.

vl7NpoAa6zsphatJ7P6Lzw.text: The service here is terrribleeeeee. Takes forever to get food, literally almost half an hour for one burger. Tried twice because we really wanted to like it. Both times, we really got frustrated with the wait and the amount of people who were also waiting long before us. The staff was eating while they were cooking!! Picking food up off the grill with their hands and eating it, then resuming to cook. The sweet potato fries were undercooked. Usually out of condiments. Staff is super rude and obviously hate their jobs'.   Live a block away and will avoid at all costs.

8QKzdMvzUWlxAjajhIJZrA.text: I'm not sure if the people who work here can't read but immediately I noticed the Kids Kale Crush Drink was missing, then I open up the meal only to see that the fries are sweet potato and not the regular kind. This was my first time ordering/eating from this place and YET AGAIN Charlotte continues to fail me when it comes to the food scene. Obviously I'm not ordering/eating from here again.   SB: DoorDash Order

tgQkvtuJhMh69jorYSjELA.text: Not bad food, it is a bit bland but I think that's part of the "healthy" enticement of the place. Foods pricy compared to serving size, but everything is promoted as organic. Smoothies aren't smooth, more watery. Was a nice visit but would like to try again in a few months.  I tried the spaghetti and meatball with the acai berry smoothie.

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegan Spaghetti &amp; meatball
Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mushroom burger fries were baked but very soft.

Nji1rEs_fY5F0FDzCQJtMQ.text: Enjoyed the kale crush smoothie this morning. My husband had the acai berry smoothie. Both were good. I didn't favor one over the other. It just depends what you're in the mood for. We both had protein powder added. These are light and filling and fills you until lunch.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States. Inside
Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States. Enjoyed the kale crush and Açaí berry smoothies with protein powder.

LccSfb8aZQfqH4IsFqeo3Q.text: I really want to like this place more but after 4 visits, I am still not impressed.   The location and service is great, but the food just never seems to wow me. Selections are health conscious and locally sourced, which is why I have continued to return but the flavor is just OK.   I have tried the eggplant and zoodles dish, sweet potato fries, and spicy avocado bowl. All are fine but never leave me with a feeling that I need to return. The acai berry smoothie on the contrary, is magnificent and is so sweet that it tastes like a guilty pleasure!

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States

zaLrNt-QetNKDawpsnEzug.text: I really enjoyed this restaurant and the food.  The food is local and fresh not leaving you with a guilty feeling. I ate the El Guapo burger with bacon, jalapeno slaw and ranch and was completely satisfied. The burger was juicy and cooked perfectly. Another thing I was impressed by was the drink selection made with no high fructose corn syrup and several different flavors. I got an agave vanilla creen soda which was delightful. Make sure to sample the different flavors you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States

q0lJVP2ICwY3cHxbY2VAwA.text: Gipped through Door Dash Ordered a $15 bowl and it's not even half full. What a joke.

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States

AaqCCmbByt_t8qb66Pmz0w.text: I always wanted to try this place but never had the opportunity to do it. Today my husband and I were going to watch the Knights game and on the way we decided to stop by and finally try it.  It is summer and has been so HOT that I've been only craving healthy and light food. My husband decided to have El Guapo burger (bacon, homemade jalapeno slaw, jalapeno ranch) and I decided to go with the Acai Berry Smoothie (acai, blueberries, pineapple, banana, almond milk, chia and lemon. My husband loved his burger and my smoothie was pretty good! The staff is nice, the place was clean and organized and the prices were average for the kind of place it is. Even though they were busy our order got done fast. They have a very interesting menu with options for kids and different options for drinks. They also have Vegan and Gluten Free. I enjoyed my visit and we will be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZeoEpJScRJgI4IMZGgT7MQ.text: This was my first time trying B Good and it was actually more than good. The atmosphere is pretty chill and reminds you of like a Five Guys, Fuel Pizza or other similar style restaurants. I work a few blocks away and have been meaning to try them out.  The menu was really straightforward and all of the options looked really good. I decided to go with the El Guapo burger. It came with crispy bacon, jalapeno slaw, and jalapeno ranch. It was very tasty and had a nice kick to it. Not too spicy, but enough to feel the heat some. For anyone wanting some more punch, they have several hot sauces to spice it to your level.  I wanted to get a shake to go with the burger, but I wasn't really feeling the price. A burger and a shake would have been over $13, not including any sides. The burger had flavor but lacked some size to it. For the price paid I would liked to have seen something a little bigger.   Overall, I had a good experience there, but I'm not sure I'd spend this kind of money again. The ingredients are fresh and are all sourced from farmers, but I'm always looking for the best bang for the buck and I don't feel as if that happened here.

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States

Gpev9h9qc17wBgTIXA7A8A.text: Great food, great service, and even better people. The first class hospitality will always make me a returning customer.

9C3p3_nTgrp7LRedtUbbsg.text: I love the salad plates here.  I'm not a vegetarian but if you love fresh veggies along w/ grilled chicken and other fresh foods, this is the place to go.   Their smoothies are also great, and soups (when they have them).

AGD0VV84Y7f1YdLF3syDPA.text: Food is absolutely delicious--if you order outside of lunchtime rush. 2 of 3 orders we placed (2 being during lunch, 1 around 7p) have either been incorrect or missing items so far. First, ordered/paid for sweet potato fries and did not receive them (only ordered one other item--a sandwich); luckily, I checked my bag before leaving. Second time we ordered one with a GF bun (my husband has Celiac so this is important) but received the regular artisanal bun so he couldn't eat his sandwich AND I ordered the BBQ chicken sandwich but instead of slaw and gruyere, they gave me the chicken version of the Mushroom & Swiss Burger (in other words, the bbq chicken but with mushrooms, swiss, and caramelized onions). We ordered delivery this time so we weren't able to go back to the counter, so to say.

BdVB05K2Y3HDUKvw_3JRxA.text: I came here seeking a healthy lunch, and B Good didn't disappoint. After a kale and chickpea bowl topped with an egg, I felt ready to tackle the rest of my day!   The prices are standard for this kind of spot, but the staff is really nice and you're getting something fairly wholesome that'll make you feel fueled. Hoping more of these pop up in northern NC!

DPlBZuGzyXw__9eR91LWjQ.text: The customer service was garbage and the cashier was rude ..she didn't even greet us, she just stared at us until we started to order . The only thing good here is the fact that it's healthy ..very upsetting ! They need to clean sweep their employees, hire some respectable people.

4j-ZimALaqrOUU2O9pxkjQ.text: Like all of the other reviews - it's just average - not amazing, not horrible. Just A-OK. I went to B Good a good handful of times this past summer because my office was given 50% off coupons.  I tried a variety of different options, but my favorite hands down was the spicy avocado lime bowl with chicken added (kale, sauteed veggies, avocado, black bean & corn salsa, tomato, queso fresco, lime, cilantro, chipotle puree, red pepper vinaigrette + chicken). It had great flavor and was very filling. I also noticed you usually got more in your bowl when you got take out vs eating at B Good. The other menu item that was delicious was the Roasted root & mushroom bowl - and of course add protein. I did learn the sweet potato fries were always hit or miss- some times they were cooked perfectly, and others they were super crispy and slightly overcooked.  However, even with the 50% off coupon, my meals were still $7-$8 for one person (no drink included) - so you're looking at $14-$16 PER PERSON for a fast casual take out place. To me, I don't think it's worth it to pay full price here. If I get another coupon, I will return, but there are so many other healthy options in Uptown you can get for a better price.

uuAPr-ayzZLJVOKYbuUPDQ.text: Staff was helpful and friendly. Veggie burger was really good. Harvest bowl was terrible--undercooked ingredients and dressing was totally bland. Probably won't return.

bdu-KKr_ODVtoLbqlHdDVQ.text: Excellent menu- both healthy and delicious! Restaurant is very clean. Friendly servers. Great price for the amount of food you get. Strongly recommend! Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grain bowl
Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States. Root ceggies
Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet Potato &amp; Bacon Salad Sweet Potato &amp; Bacon Salad, veggie bufger

7_LPsuBYUdEdGsDptEJ1sw.text: Quick. Wholesome. Friendly. Tasty.  This is my go to lunch spot above all others in uptown. It doesn't matter if you're a hungry hungry hippo or just in need of a quick smoothie B Good has what you need. They over a plethora of vegan and vegetarian options and  they also have meat. It's hard to find a good gluten free bun, but B Good has one. Do your self a favor and try the vegan burger. Dress it up any way you see fit, you won't be let down by this tasty handheld. Oh, and before I forget, order the damn sweet potato fries!

photos.caption: Photo of B.GOOD - Charlotte, NC, United States
